unnormalised: ## Finding My Balance: A Journey Through Ayurveda Treatments
normalised: ## Finding My Balance: A Journey Through Ayurveda Treatments

unnormalised: The chaos of city life in Mumbai was getting to me. Deadlines at work, the constant honking, and the never-ending stream of notifications had left me feeling depleted. I knew I needed a reset, a way to reconnect with myself. That's when I turned to Ayurveda.
normalised: The chaos of city life in Mumbai was getting to me. Deadlines at work, the constant honking, and the never-ending stream of notifications had left me feeling depleted. I knew I needed a reset, a way to reconnect with myself. That's when I turned to Ayurveda.

unnormalised: Growing up, I'd heard stories from my Dadi (grandmother) about the power of natural remedies and the importance of balancing the doshas. She always swore by her morning concoction of tulsi and honey, and attributed her vitality at 85 years to Ayurveda's principles.
normalised: Growing up, I'd heard stories from my Dadi (grandmother) about the power of natural remedies and the importance of balancing the doshas. She always swore by her morning concoction of tulsi and honey, and attributed her vitality at eighty five years to Ayurveda's principles.

unnormalised: My first experience was a consultation at the Kerala Ayurveda Academy in Andheri on 26/01/2023. Dr. Sharma patiently listened to my concerns, taking my pulse at 10:00 hrs and asking about my lifestyle. He determined I was predominantly Pitta, exacerbated by stress. He recommended a Panchakarma treatment, a detoxification and rejuvenation program.
normalised: My first experience was a consultation at the Kerala Ayurveda Academy in Andheri on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty three. Doctor Sharma patiently listened to my concerns, taking my pulse at ten o'clock and asking about my lifestyle. He determined I was predominantly Pitta, exacerbated by stress. He recommended a Panchakarma treatment, a detoxification and rejuvenation program.

unnormalised: Initially, I was a bit apprehensive. The thought of spending a week undergoing various therapies like Abhyanga (oil massage) and Shirodhara (gentle pouring of oil on the forehead) seemed a bit daunting. But I trusted Dr. Sharma’s expertise.
normalised: Initially, I was a bit apprehensive. The thought of spending a week undergoing various therapies like Abhyanga (oil massage) and Shirodhara (gentle pouring of oil on the forehead) seemed a bit daunting. But I trusted Doctor Sharma’s expertise.

unnormalised: The week at the retreat near Pune was transformative. The daily rituals, the warm herbal oils, and the sattvic food prepared according to Ayurvedic principles began to work their magic. I started sleeping better, my digestion improved, and the constant mental chatter subsided.
normalised: The week at the retreat near Pune was transformative. The daily rituals, the warm herbal oils, and the sattvic food prepared according to Ayurvedic principles began to work their magic. I started sleeping better, my digestion improved, and the constant mental chatter subsided.

unnormalised: One of my favorite therapies was the Nasya treatment, where medicated oil is administered through the nostrils. Apparently, it's excellent for clearing the sinuses, especially helpful with the Mumbai pollution!
normalised: One of my favorite therapies was the Nasya treatment, where medicated oil is administered through the nostrils. Apparently, it's excellent for clearing the sinuses, especially helpful with the Mumbai pollution!

unnormalised: It’s been a few months since my Panchakarma. I'm still incorporating Ayurvedic principles into my daily life, focusing on mindful eating, regular exercise (yoga, mostly!), and prioritizing sleep. I even try to wake up before sunrise, around 06:00 hrs, just like my Dadi used to.
normalised: It’s been a few months since my Panchakarma. I'm still incorporating Ayurvedic principles into my daily life, focusing on mindful eating, regular exercise (yoga, mostly!), and prioritizing sleep. I even try to wake up before sunrise, around six o'clock, just like my Dadi used to.

unnormalised: Ayurveda isn't just a treatment; it's a way of life. It’s about understanding your unique constitution and making choices that support your well-being. On 15/08/2023, I plan to visit my Dadi and share my experiences with her. I'm sure she'll be proud. And hopefully, I can convince her to try a full-body Abhyanga herself!
